Definition: In this task, you're given the first four sentences of a five-sentence story, and the title of the story. Your job is write the last sentence of the story such that it does not connect with the rest of the story.

Positive Examples.input: Title: Marcus Buys Khakis. Sentence 1: Marcus needed clothing for a business casual event. Sentence 2: All of his clothes were either too formal or too casual. Sentence 3: He decided to buy a pair of khakis. Sentence 4: The pair he bought fit him perfectly.
Positive Examples.output: Marcus was happy to have the right clothes for the event.
Positive Examples.explanation: Marcus is buying clothes for a business event.

Positive Examples.input: Title: Corn. Sentence 1: Laura loved corn. Sentence 2: So she decided to grow some in her backyard. Sentence 3: The whole process of growing them made her very excited. Sentence 4: But she realized that they required too much water.
Positive Examples.output: So Laura quickly abandoned her corn garden idea.
Positive Examples.explanation: Laura is deciding on whether she should plant corn.

Positive Examples.output: By lunch the whole office had passed out and nothing got done.
Positive Examples.explanation: Larry is throwing an office party and people crashed affter partying.

Positive Examples.explanation: Ben could not find his frog, so it must have left on its own.

Sentence 3: Suddenly, right in front of us, was a huge moose. Sentence 4: It was so close that it scared us, but they told me not to run.
Negative Examples.output: They then went back to wait for the next egg to hatch.

Negative Examples.input: Title: Eggplant Parmesan. Sentence 1: Mary sliced the purple eggplant. Sentence 2: Then she breaded each slice carefully before frying them. Sentence 3: She layered each breaded slice into her casserole dish. Sentence 4: She poured homemade marinara sauce in the dish.

Negative Examples.explanation: The story describes how eggplant parmesan is made, and does not talk aobut trying new foods.
